xmlns:ns="http://xml.netbeans.org/schema/VacationApproval" xmlns:plnk="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsbpel/2.0/plnktype" xmlns:file="http://schemas.sun.com/jbi/wsdl-extensions/file/"> <types> </xsd:schema> </types> <message name="VacationApprovalOperationRequest"> <part name="part1" element="ns:vacationRequest"/> </message> <message name="VacationApprovalOperationReply"> <part name="part1" element="ns:vacationReply"/> </message> <portType name="submitVacationRequest"> <wsdl:operation name="VacationApprovalOperation"> <wsdl:input name="input1" message="tns:VacationApprovalOperationRequest"/> <!--<wsdl:output name="output1" message="tns:VacationApprovalOperationReply"/>--> </wsdl:operation> </portType> <portType name="approveVacationRequest"> <wsdl:operation name="VacationApprovalOperation"> <wsdl:input name="input1" message="tns:VacationApprovalOperationRequest"/> <wsdl:output name="output1" message="tns:VacationApprovalOperationReply"/> </wsdl:operation> </portType> <portType name="submitVacationRequestFileOut"> <wsdl:operation name="VacationApprovalOperation"> <wsdl:input name="output1" message="tns:VacationApprovalOperationReply"/> </wsdl:operation> </portType> <binding name="VacationApprovalBinding" type="tns:approveVacationRequest"> <soap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="VacationApprovalOperation"> <soap:operation/> <wsdl:input name="input1"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output name="output1"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </binding> <binding name="VacationSubmitBinding" type="tns:submitVacationRequest"> <soap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="VacationApprovalOperation"> <soap:operation/> <wsdl:input name="input1"> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> </wsdl:operation> </binding> <binding name="VacationApprovalFileOutBinding" type="tns:submitVacationRequestFileOut"> <file:binding/> <operation name="VacationApprovalOperation"> <file:operation/> <input name="output1"> <file:message use="literal" fileName="VacationApprovalOperationReply.xml" multipleRecordsPerFile="false" part="part1" fileNameIsPattern="false" addEOL="false"/> </input> </operation> </binding> <service name="VacationApprovalService"> <wsdl:port name="VacationApprovalPort" binding="tns:VacationApprovalBinding"> <soap:address location="http://localhost:18181/VacationApprovalService/VacationApprovalPort"/> </wsdl:port> </service> <service name="VacationApprovalFileOutService"> <port name="VacationApprovalFileOutPort" binding="tns:VacationApprovalFileOutBinding"> <file:address fileDirectory="/home/mei/work/open-jbi-components/driver-tests/wlmse/Escalation_Xpath/VacationApprovalCompositeApp/soapui/output"/> </port> </service> <service name="VacationSubmitService"> <port name="VacationSubmitPort" binding="tns:VacationSubmitBinding"> <soap:address location="http://localhost:18181/VacationSubmitService/VacationApprovalPort"/> </port> </service> <plnk:partnerLinkType name="VacationApproval1"> <!--A partner link type is automatically generated when a new port type is added. Partner link types are used by BPEL processes. In a BPEL process, a partner link represents the interaction between the BPEL process and a partner service. Each partner link is associated with a partner link type. A partner link type characterizes the conversational relationship between two services. The partner link type can have one or two roles.--> <plnk:role name="approveVacationRequestRole" portType="tns:approveVacationRequest"/> </plnk:partnerLinkType> <plnk:partnerLinkType name="VacationSubmit1"> <!--A partner link type is automatically generated when a new port type is added. Partner link types are used by BPEL processes. In a BPEL process, a partner link represents the interaction between the BPEL process and a partner service. Each partner link is associated with a partner link type. A partner link type characterizes the conversational relationship between two services. The partner link type can have one or two roles.--> <plnk:role name="submitVacationRequestRole" portType="tns:submitVacationRequest"/> </plnk:partnerLinkType> <plnk:partnerLinkType name="VacationOutPutFile"> <!--A partner link type is automatically generated when a new port type is added. Partner link types are used by BPEL processes. In a BPEL process, a partner link represents the interaction between the BPEL process and a partner service. Each partner link is associated with a partner link type. A partner link type characterizes the conversational relationship between two services. The partner link type can have one or two roles.--> <plnk:role name="outputVacationReplyRole" portType="tns:submitVacationRequestFileOut"/> </plnk:partnerLinkType> </definitions>
